name: remilitarize
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to bring military forces back into an area: The government is planning to remilitarize the nation's borders. The country shows little desire to remilitarize and start throwing its weight around.
to make a police force similar to a military force again, for example by giving it military weapons: He denied that there were any plans to remilitarize the police. Whole areas of the country are out of the government's control, yet few people think the solution is to remilitarize the police.
More examplesFewer examplesThe government is believed to have remilitarised the oil-rich regions in the south of the country.The Allies did nothing to stop Germany from remilitarizing the Rhineland in 1936.The dictator promptly went back on the deal and remilitarized the disputed region.
